forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 10pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 20. West wind 9 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 47 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Washington's Birthday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 27. West wind 20 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 55 mph.

weather_report:
As evening descends upon Boston, the air carries the promise of rain, a gentle but insistent reminder that winter is still firmly in its grasp. The clouds loom heavily, their dark forms dripping with moisture, while a brisk west wind whips through the streets, sending a shiver through those bold enough to venture outside. The temperature hovers near a chill that urges the wise to bundle in layers, perhaps donning a sturdy coat paired with a wool scarf; warm gloves will also provide a welcome shield against the biting breeze. The rain, expected to grace the city until around ten, will likely leave the ground sparkling with a layer of fresh droplets, offering a moment of serene beauty amid the storm.

Looking ahead to Washington's Birthday, a transformation awaits—a scattered sky giving way to glimpses of sunlight across the city. As the sun fights to shine through, the temperature will crawl to a more agreeable level, urging residents to cast off their winter blues in favor of outdoor pursuits. A brisk walk through the quiet, snow-dusted streets or a quiet moment at a local café with a steaming cup may be just the balm the soul needs, gently nudging you to admire the beauty of a winter nearly at its end. Remembering to dress warmly will be paramount, but today, a sense of adventure beckons amid the shifting weather, inviting all to embrace the unique rhythm of this chilly season.
